intro: Erigeron kermanensis, commonly known as the Kerman fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron kermanensis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
